snippet: The interior minister denied that Giulio Regeni, whose brutalized body was found near Cairo last week, had been in police custody before his murder.
abstract: Egyptian Interior Min Maj Gen Magdi Abdel-Ghaffar repudiates suggestion that Italian student whose tortured body turned up outside Cairo was detained by authorities during crackdown on dissidents; Italian officials demand detailed investigation of disappearance of Giulio Regeni.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and NOUR YOUSSEF
byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: The interior minister denied that Giulio Regeni, whose brutalized body was found near Cairo last week, had been in police custody before his murder.

headline.main: Egypt Official Rejects Any Role of Security Forces in Italian’s Killing
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Official Rejects Talk of Security Forces’ Role in Killing of Italian
